intro: Pentacalia luteynorum, commonly known as the yellow pentacalia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Campanulaceae. It is native to the southern United States, particularly Florida and Texas, where it thrives in sandy, well-drained soils. The plant is characterized by its showy, yellow to orange tubular flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It typically grows as a low-growing shrub with woody stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Pentacalia luteynorum is often found in coastal dunes and other xeric habitats, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environmental conditions.
